title: A Look into December 2024 Destruction in EVE Online – Winter Nexus and Years End
description: CCP gave us the final MER for 2024 last week, so we now have the complete set.  That means at some point I will combine all of the 2024 data into a giant set of charts as I did last year… and then I will compare them to the few stats that CCP trotted out […]
author: Wilhelm Arcturus
excerpt: CCP gave us the final MER for 2024 last week, so we now have the complete set. That means at some point I will combine all of the 2024 data into a giant set of charts as I did last year… and…
text: CCP gave us the final MER for 2024 last week, so we now have the complete set.  That means at some point I will combine all of the 2024 data into a giant set of charts as I did last year… and then I will compare them to the few stats that CCP trotted out in the December edition of The Pulse so we can see how CCP can’t even present consistent numbers. Last year the amount they announced on their video was double what the MER data showed. But that is yet to come.  This post is to go through December destruction to close out the year and see if the economic changes with the Revenant expansion ramped up destruction. EVE Online nerds harder As always, I am going to cover destruction.  Here are the usual places to look if you want more details or different coverage of New Eden economic activity for the month. CCP – December 2024 Monthly Economic Report CCP – December 2024 MER Forum Thread Reddit – December 2024 MER Thread TNG – December 2024 Activity In EVE Online TNG – A Look At The December 2024 Active ISK Delta YouTube – December MER Analysis with CSM Oz Overall Summary It is often tough to for the month AFTER an expansion.  CCP does a lot of promotions, gives away free game time, and generally tries to get people into the game to experience the new stuff.  And then it wanders off, either to fix (or in the case of Equinox, finish) the expansion, start on the next expansion, or go on vacation. On such has been build the legend of the summer slump.  But December has the ISK faucet event of the Winter Nexus.  Is that enough though?  And does that event get more ships blowing up? Looking at Jester’s charts, it appears that players in the game dipped in December after peaking for the Revenant expansion and its give-aways. Dec 2024 – EVE Players logged in Not that December was bad or anything.  In the scope of the last four years it was about the best of Decembers, keeping on par with 2023 which followed the Havoc expansion that looked to revive the players logged in. Dec 2024 – Four Year Logins Comparo So logins were down some, but not drastically.  How about explosions? Well, explosions were down. December saw reported 479,812 hulls, structures, and capsules destroyed. That was down from 531,081 in November, the year’s peak, and down from the 496,807 reported in October. For explosions December was below the median for 2023, but only just so. Fewer things exploded and there were 31 days in the month, so the average losses per day sank from 17,702 to 15,477 in December. Dec 2024 – Avg Losses per Day Again, that is down around the low point for 2024, but 2024 overall was up for almost every month.  Being at the low end of the best situation is still better that being the high point of, say, 2022 when CCP was deep into the scarcity era and the starvation economy.   They still haven’t fixed that… the mineral price index hit an all time high because isogen is still a bottleneck and CCP obstinately refuses to see that gating it in low sec was a bad idea… but things are better. The ISK front did not see a similar dip, with December seeing 46.77 trillion in losses, a bit up from November’s 45.15 trillion ISK. But November only saw small uptick from the 44.78 trillion ISK in losses seen in October, so the ISK lost has remained somewhat flat while the count has gone up and down. That means more expensive stuff blew up in December, with the average loss ringing in at 97.48 million ISK, up from the 85 million ISK per day in November, though the average total losses per day remained just over 1.5 trillion ISK. That once more day in December mattered. All of that corresponds to 1.5 trillion ISK lost per day in November and 1.44 trillion ISK per day in October for a before, during, and after expansion dynamic. In the end less stuff blew up, but it was slightly more expensive stuff. The month itself flowed in the usual pattern, high points on weekend, valleys during the week. Dec 2024 – Losses per Day The low point in losses was December 25th, Christmas day.  I guess we had better things to do then. So it goes, another month has swept by and 2024 is done.  On to the regular charts. Top 20 Most Frequent Losses by Class and Hull Back with the usual suspects. Class  Count  % of Dec Hull  Count  % of Dec Capsule        115,303 24.03% Capsule        113,937 23.75% Shuttle           58,664 12.23% Caldari Shuttle           24,419 5.09% Frigate           55,159 11.50% Ibis           20,003 4.17% Cruiser           42,181 8.79% Mobile Tractor Unit           11,926 2.49% Corvette           34,064 7.10% Gallente Shuttle           11,453 2.39% Destroyer           28,938 6.03% Amarr Shuttle           11,350 2.37% Combat Battlecruiser           16,384 3.41% Minmatar Shuttle           10,845 2.26% Mobile Tractor Unit           12,491 2.60% Venture           10,460 2.18% Battleship             8,981 1.87% Reaper             7,369 1.54% Heavy Assault Cruiser             8,799 1.83% Vexor             6,873 1.43% Interdictor             8,789 1.83% Heron             6,424 1.34% Interceptor             8,357 1.74% Exequror Navy Issue             5,365 1.12% Hauler             8,045 1.68% Ishtar             5,328 1.11% Assault Frigate             7,882 1.64% Thrasher             5,081 1.06% Strategic Cruiser             5,032 1.05% Algos             4,389 0.91% Covert Ops             4,889 1.02% Sabre             3,928 0.82% Mining Barge             4,491 0.94% Velator             3,903 0.81% Mobile Warp Disruptor             4,412 0.92% Praxis             3,614 0.75% Expedition Frigate             4,146 0.86% Catalyst             3,353 0.70% Tactical Destroyer             3,823 0.80% Catalyst Navy Issue             3,006 0.63% Shuttles and the doughty Ibis top the charts, but it seems like the normal mix.  Maybe a few more Herons lost due to the Winter Nexus, but otherwise about what was expected. Hulls Lost only Once This Month The flip side, the rare losses for the month. Hull Count AIR Civilian Astero 1 Avatar 1 Boobook 1 Caiman 1 Civilian Minmatar Shuttle 1 Covert Mobile Cynosural Beacon 1 Cybele 1 Guristas Pirates FOB 1 Keepstar 1 Miasmos Amastris Edition 1 Pharolux Cyno Beacon 1 Ragnarok 1 Small Mobile Siphon Unit 1 There are some questions about the single losses this month, like why was that PH Caiman killed by PH?  What was going on with that Keepstar? (I suspect it was part of the INIT new years reset.) And how are there still mobile siphon units still out in the wild. But at least that Cybele was an AT loss.  So something very expensive departed New Eden. Top 20 Total ISK Lost by Hull Type Then we start talking about the price of things. Hull Count Sum of ISK Lost % of Dec ISK per Loss Capsule 113,937 3,529.30 billion 7.55% 30.98 million Vargur 982 2,396.92 billion 5.12% 2,440.85 million Loki 2,093 1,647.96 billion 3.52% 787.37 million Golem 649 1,484.28 billion 3.17% 2,287.03 million Ishtar 5,328 1,381.32 billion 2.95% 259.26 million Kronos 678 1,375.78 billion 2.94% 2,029.17 million Paladin 574 1,143.91 billion 2.45% 1,992.87 million Praxis 3,614 1,136.76 billion 2.43% 314.54 million Tengu 1,320 1,096.74 billion 2.34% 830.87 million Gila 2,178 858.02 billion 1.83% 393.95 million Proteus 896 745.08 billion 1.59% 831.57 million Revelation 115 583.76 billion 1.25% 5,076.16 million Legion 723 565.39 billion 1.21% 782.00 million Redeemer 321 555.10 billion 1.19% 1,729.29 million Exequror Navy Issue 5,365 495.41 billion 1.06% 92.34 million Astero 2,589 479.50 billion 1.03% 185.21 million Athanor 217 461.60 billion 0.99% 2,127.19 million Occator 564 457.24 billion 0.98% 810.71 million Nestor 212 431.27 billion 0.92% 2,034.28 million Rhea 39 408.30 billion 0.87% 10,469.26 million Kind of surprised to see 217 Athanors on the list.  Somebody was clearing out mining operations.  Meanwhile a mere 39 Rheas might be at the bottom of the list, but the price per loss was pretty steep… though that might be close to just the base hull price, depending on how CCP is calculating it.  CCP has a valuation problem, as always.  Next time we’re going to see a trillion ISK single ship loss for January that I bet doesn’t make it to this chart because there is no market data for CCP to work with. Top 20 Regions by ISK and Hull Losses Where in New Eden were things being blow up. Region Sum of ISK Lost % of Dec Region  Count % of Dec The Forge 2.14 trillion 4.57% The Forge        52,696 10.98% The Citadel 1.85 trillion 3.95% Heimatar        24,336 5.07% Pochven 1.69 trillion 3.62% Lonetrek        24,081 5.02% Vale of the Silent 1.66 trillion 3.56% Vale of the Silent        14,994 3.12% Lonetrek 1.65 trillion 3.53% The Citadel        14,204 2.96% Fountain 1.43 trillion 3.05% Essence        13,948 2.91% Sinq Laison 1.41 trillion 3.02% Pochven        13,628 2.84% Black Rise 1.27 trillion 2.73% Placid        13,493 2.81% Placid 1.25 trillion 2.66% Metropolis        12,991 2.71% Heimatar 1.24 trillion 2.65% Black Rise        12,949 2.70% Genesis 1.22 trillion 2.60% Perrigen Falls        12,523 2.61% Delve 1.03 trillion 2.21% Genesis        12,371 2.58% Perrigen Falls 1.00 trillion 2.13% Fountain        12,041 2.51% Metropolis .91 trillion 1.94% Delve        11,311 2.36% Catch .90 trillion 1.93% The Bleak Lands        11,267 2.35% Providence .88 trillion 1.88% Sinq Laison        10,238 2.13% The Bleak Lands .87 trillion 1.86% Tenerifis           9,577 2.00% Tenerifis .81 trillion 1.73% Catch           8,756 1.82% Immensea .79 trillion 1.68% Providence           8,319 1.73% Domain .78 trillion 1.68% Tribute           8,167 1.70% When it comes to value lost, a null sec region doesn’t even show up until 4th position with Vale of the Silent.  Pochven gave way to both The Forge and The Citadel for value. When it comes to the count of losses The Forge will always be up at the top so long as Uitra carries on, but we’ll get to that. Top 20 Systems by ISK and Hull Losses Narrowing the scope, what systems saw the most losses in ISK and total count. System Region Sum of ISK Lost % of Dec System Region  Count % of Dec Ahbazon Genesis 964.80 billion 2.06% Uitra The Forge             36,117 7.53% Jita The Forge 717.55 billion 1.53% Ahbazon Genesis             10,323 2.15% Tama The Citadel 379.12 billion 0.81% Jita The Forge               8,207 1.71% MJ-5F9 Perrigen Falls 307.37 billion 0.66% Jouvulen Lonetrek               7,097 1.48% Sivala The Citadel 284.98 billion 0.61% Malukker Heimatar               6,152 1.28% Maila The Forge 269.82 billion 0.58% Heydieles Essence               5,294 1.10% Sakenta Pochven 248.55 billion 0.53% Akiainavas Lonetrek               4,996 1.04% Amamake Heimatar 246.92 billion 0.53% Amamake Heimatar               4,527 0.94% 4-HWWF Vale of the Silent 246.11 billion 0.53% Tama The Citadel               4,444 0.93% EC-P8R Pure Blind 228.35 billion 0.49% MJ-5F9 Perrigen Falls               3,936 0.82% Vard Heimatar 220.21 billion 0.47% Vard Heimatar               3,482 0.73% Abudban Heimatar 214.37 billion 0.46% Conoban Kor-Azor               3,054 0.64% Urlen The Forge 205.48 billion 0.44% Kamela The Bleak Lands               2,682 0.56% Heydieles Essence 200.21 billion 0.43% Kinakka Black Rise               2,613 0.54% Sahtogas The Bleak Lands 198.61 billion 0.42% UALX-3 Tenerifis               2,607 0.54% Kinakka Black Rise 196.03 billion 0.42% Vlillirier Placid               2,604 0.54% Heild Molden Heath 174.27 billion 0.37% 4-HWWF Vale of the Silent               2,549 0.53% Aunsou Placid 170.44 billion 0.36% Siseide Heimatar               2,288 0.48% C-N4OD Fountain 170.20 billion 0.36% BWF-ZZ Geminate               2,260 0.47% UALX-3 Tenerifis 168.72 billion 0.36% Rancer Sinq Laison               2,238 0.47% I don’t want to say things were totally quiet in null sec, but with Tenerifis in 18th place for regions and our stager in UALX-3 in 20th for systems, December was not perhaps that active down in our corner. Top 10 Systems for Shuttle and Corvette Losses I covered what was going on in Uitra in a full post last month, so if you want the story you can go there.  So I will stop obsessing about that and, instead, just post systems where shuttles and corvettes are being eaten up in pursuit of AIR Career Program farming. Class  Count  Sum of ISK lost System Region Shuttle        23,553 .52 billion Uitra The Forge Shuttle           6,004 .14 billion Jouvulen Lonetrek Shuttle           3,550 .09 billion Akiainavas Lonetrek Shuttle           2,969 .07 billion Conoban Kor-Azor Shuttle           1,655 .03 billion J115651 B-R00005 Shuttle           1,632 13.84 billion Jita The Forge Shuttle           1,545 21.65 billion Ahbazon Genesis Shuttle           1,492 .05 billion Deepari Domain Shuttle              918 .02 billion Trossere Sinq Laison Shuttle              908 .02 billion Malukker Heimatar I only need to go ten deep for these charts as the counts fall off pretty fast. Uitra is still the shuttle death champion being the closest tutorial system to Jita.  But Jita and Ahbazon each show that some people are using shuttles to transport expensive stuff still. Class  Count  Sum of ISK lost System Region Corvette           12,476 1.13 billion Uitra The Forge Corvette             5,242 .48 billion Malukker Heimatar Corvette             1,475 8.96 billion Jita The Forge Corvette             1,404 .08 billion Akiainavas Lonetrek Corvette             1,020 .09 billion Jouvulen Lonetrek Corvette                930 2.44 billion Ahbazon Genesis Corvette                664 .06 billion Niyabainen The Forge Corvette                448 1.13 billion Tama The Citadel Corvette                377 .04 billion Pasha Tash-Murkon Corvette                161 .13 billion Amarr Domain Corvettes are also used for AIR Career Program farming, so Uitra is on top again.  Also, Jita and Abhazon keeping it real with the expensive losses. And so it goes.
html:
CCP gave us the final MER for 2024 last week, so we now have the complete set.  That means at some point I will combine all of the 2024 data into a giant set of charts as I did last year… and then I will compare them to the few stats that CCP trotted out in the December edition of The Pulse so we can see how CCP can’t even present consistent numbers.

Last year the amount they announced on their video was double what the MER data showed.

But that is yet to come.  This post is to go through December destruction to close out the year and see if the economic changes with the Revenant expansion ramped up destruction.

EVE Online nerds harder

As always, I am going to cover destruction.  Here are the usual places to look if you want more details or different coverage of New Eden economic activity for the month.

  • CCP – December 2024 Monthly Economic Report
  • CCP – December 2024 MER Forum Thread
  • Reddit – December 2024 MER Thread
  • TNG – December 2024 Activity In EVE Online
  • TNG – A Look At The December 2024 Active ISK Delta
  • YouTube – December MER Analysis with CSM Oz

Overall Summary

It is often tough to for the month AFTER an expansion.  CCP does a lot of promotions, gives away free game time, and generally tries to get people into the game to experience the new stuff.  And then it wanders off, either to fix (or in the case of Equinox, finish) the expansion, start on the next expansion, or go on vacation.

On such has been build the legend of the summer slump.  But December has the ISK faucet event of the Winter Nexus.  Is that enough though?  And does that event get more ships blowing up?

Looking at Jester’s charts, it appears that players in the game dipped in December after peaking for the Revenant expansion and its give-aways.

Dec 2024 – EVE Players logged in

Not that December was bad or anything.  In the scope of the last four years it was about the best of Decembers, keeping on par with 2023 which followed the Havoc expansion that looked to revive the players logged in.

Dec 2024 – Four Year Logins Comparo

So logins were down some, but not drastically.  How about explosions?

Well, explosions were down.

December saw reported 479,812 hulls, structures, and capsules destroyed. That was down from 531,081 in November, the year’s peak, and down from the 496,807 reported in October. For explosions December was below the median for 2023, but only just so. Fewer things exploded and there were 31 days in the month, so the average losses per day sank from 17,702 to 15,477 in December.

Dec 2024 – Avg Losses per Day

Again, that is down around the low point for 2024, but 2024 overall was up for almost every month.  Being at the low end of the best situation is still better that being the high point of, say, 2022 when CCP was deep into the scarcity era and the starvation economy.   They still haven’t fixed that… the mineral price index hit an all time high because isogen is still a bottleneck and CCP obstinately refuses to see that gating it in low sec was a bad idea… but things are better.

The ISK front did not see a similar dip, with December seeing 46.77 trillion in losses, a bit up from November’s 45.15 trillion ISK. But November only saw small uptick from the 44.78 trillion ISK in losses seen in October, so the ISK lost has remained somewhat flat while the count has gone up and down.

That means more expensive stuff blew up in December, with the average loss ringing in at 97.48 million ISK, up from the 85 million ISK per day in November, though the average total losses per day remained just over 1.5 trillion ISK. That once more day in December mattered.

All of that corresponds to 1.5 trillion ISK lost per day in November and 1.44 trillion ISK per day in October for a before, during, and after expansion dynamic.

In the end less stuff blew up, but it was slightly more expensive stuff.

The month itself flowed in the usual pattern, high points on weekend, valleys during the week.

Dec 2024 – Losses per Day

The low point in losses was December 25th, Christmas day.  I guess we had better things to do then.

So it goes, another month has swept by and 2024 is done.  On to the regular charts.

Top 20 Most Frequent Losses by Class and Hull

Back with the usual suspects.

Class  Count  % of Dec Hull  Count  % of Dec
Capsule        115,303 24.03% Capsule        113,937 23.75%
Shuttle           58,664 12.23% Caldari Shuttle           24,419 5.09%
Frigate           55,159 11.50% Ibis           20,003 4.17%
Cruiser           42,181 8.79% Mobile Tractor Unit           11,926 2.49%
Corvette           34,064 7.10% Gallente Shuttle           11,453 2.39%
Destroyer           28,938 6.03% Amarr Shuttle           11,350 2.37%
Combat Battlecruiser           16,384 3.41% Minmatar Shuttle           10,845 2.26%
Mobile Tractor Unit           12,491 2.60% Venture           10,460 2.18%
Battleship             8,981 1.87% Reaper             7,369 1.54%
Heavy Assault Cruiser             8,799 1.83% Vexor             6,873 1.43%
Interdictor             8,789 1.83% Heron             6,424 1.34%
Interceptor             8,357 1.74% Exequror Navy Issue             5,365 1.12%
Hauler             8,045 1.68% Ishtar             5,328 1.11%
Assault Frigate             7,882 1.64% Thrasher             5,081 1.06%
Strategic Cruiser             5,032 1.05% Algos             4,389 0.91%
Covert Ops             4,889 1.02% Sabre             3,928 0.82%
Mining Barge             4,491 0.94% Velator             3,903 0.81%
Mobile Warp Disruptor             4,412 0.92% Praxis             3,614 0.75%
Expedition Frigate             4,146 0.86% Catalyst             3,353 0.70%
Tactical Destroyer             3,823 0.80% Catalyst Navy Issue             3,006 0.63%

Shuttles and the doughty Ibis top the charts, but it seems like the normal mix.  Maybe a few more Herons lost due to the Winter Nexus, but otherwise about what was expected.

Hulls Lost only Once This Month

The flip side, the rare losses for the month.

Hull Count
AIR Civilian Astero 1
Avatar 1
Boobook 1
Caiman 1
Civilian Minmatar Shuttle 1
Covert Mobile Cynosural Beacon 1
Cybele 1
Guristas Pirates FOB 1
Keepstar 1
Miasmos Amastris Edition 1
Pharolux Cyno Beacon 1
Ragnarok 1
Small Mobile Siphon Unit 1

There are some questions about the single losses this month, like why was that PH Caiman killed by PH?  What was going on with that Keepstar? (I suspect it was part of the INIT new years reset.) And how are there still mobile siphon units still out in the wild.

But at least that Cybele was an AT loss.  So something very expensive departed New Eden.

Top 20 Total ISK Lost by Hull Type

Then we start talking about the price of things.

Hull Count Sum of ISK Lost % of Dec ISK per Loss
Capsule 113,937 3,529.30 billion 7.55% 30.98 million
Vargur 982 2,396.92 billion 5.12% 2,440.85 million
Loki 2,093 1,647.96 billion 3.52% 787.37 million
Golem 649 1,484.28 billion 3.17% 2,287.03 million
Ishtar 5,328 1,381.32 billion 2.95% 259.26 million
Kronos 678 1,375.78 billion 2.94% 2,029.17 million
Paladin 574 1,143.91 billion 2.45% 1,992.87 million
Praxis 3,614 1,136.76 billion 2.43% 314.54 million
Tengu 1,320 1,096.74 billion 2.34% 830.87 million
Gila 2,178 858.02 billion 1.83% 393.95 million
Proteus 896 745.08 billion 1.59% 831.57 million
Revelation 115 583.76 billion 1.25% 5,076.16 million
Legion 723 565.39 billion 1.21% 782.00 million
Redeemer 321 555.10 billion 1.19% 1,729.29 million
Exequror Navy Issue 5,365 495.41 billion 1.06% 92.34 million
Astero 2,589 479.50 billion 1.03% 185.21 million
Athanor 217 461.60 billion 0.99% 2,127.19 million
Occator 564 457.24 billion 0.98% 810.71 million
Nestor 212 431.27 billion 0.92% 2,034.28 million
Rhea 39 408.30 billion 0.87% 10,469.26 million

Kind of surprised to see 217 Athanors on the list.  Somebody was clearing out mining operations.  Meanwhile a mere 39 Rheas might be at the bottom of the list, but the price per loss was pretty steep… though that might be close to just the base hull price, depending on how CCP is calculating it.  CCP has a valuation problem, as always.  Next time we’re going to see a trillion ISK single ship loss for January that I bet doesn’t make it to this chart because there is no market data for CCP to work with.

Top 20 Regions by ISK and Hull Losses

Where in New Eden were things being blow up.

When it comes to value lost, a null sec region doesn’t even show up until 4th position with Vale of the Silent.  Pochven gave way to both The Forge and The Citadel for value.

When it comes to the count of losses The Forge will always be up at the top so long as Uitra carries on, but we’ll get to that.

Top 20 Systems by ISK and Hull Losses

Narrowing the scope, what systems saw the most losses in ISK and total count.

I don’t want to say things were totally quiet in null sec, but with Tenerifis in 18th place for regions and our stager in UALX-3 in 20th for systems, December was not perhaps that active down in our corner.

Top 10 Systems for Shuttle and Corvette Losses

I covered what was going on in Uitra in a full post last month, so if you want the story you can go there.  So I will stop obsessing about that and, instead, just post systems where shuttles and corvettes are being eaten up in pursuit of AIR Career Program farming.
